newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Northrop Grumman to buy Tadiran batteries. [CORRECTED 14:51 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Northrop Grumman to buy Tadiran batteries. [CORRECTED 14:51 GMT]

text.p: Israel's Tadiran Ltd said on Tuesday it received an initial $250,000 order from Northrop Grumman Corp (corrects spelling of the company name) for lithium batteries.

In a statement, the Israeli electronics firm said its batteries unit expected to receive in 1997-1998 additional orders from the U.S. company, totalling some $2.5 million, for the lithium batteries which will power cordless modems.
Tadiran said the lightweight, high-energy battery had been under development for the past seven years and $10 million had been invested in a production line.
